analyzed: gal te mi gtong na gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya / yang dag par bstan par bya'o // lan gnyis lan gsum du yang @12a *// dag par bsgo /
translated: But if they do not give it up, they should be pressed up to three times to give it up.🔽If they give it up when pressed up to three times, all is well.

original: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /

analyzed: gal te mi gtong na chos 'di yang lan gsum gyi bar gyis ltung bar 'gyur la 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste /

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni skrod par mi byed do zhes ma zer cig /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: khyed kyis khyim dag sun phyung ba yang mthong zhing thos la rab tu shes /

analyzed: khyed sdig pa kun tu spyod par yang mthong zhing thos la rab tu shes pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'phags ma dag 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lam dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba /

analyzed: 'jigs pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lam 'di lta bu 'di thong zhig ces bsgo bar bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong ma de dag la dge slong ma rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na /

analyzed: 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste dge 'dun lhag ma'o // 'di na dge slong @13a *//

translated: The nuns said to that nun, “Noble one, when the nuns speak to you in accord with the Dharma and in accord with the Vinaya, about the bases of training that are to be learned by nuns and about what is included in the sūtras of the Well-Gone One, do not make yourself not to be spoken to. Noble one, you must make yourself to be spoken to.🔽The nuns speak to the noble one in accord with the Dharma and in accord with the Vinaya.

analyzed: 'phags ma yang dge slong ma rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smros shig /
translated: Noble one, you also must speak to the nuns in accord with the Dharma and in accord with the Vinaya.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gcig la gcig brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa dang / gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes @13b su ston pa dang / gcig la gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i 'khor 'di 'phel bar 'gyur gyi 'phags ma khyod bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las
translated: They are mutually supportive, mutually encouraging, mutually instructing, and mutually uplifting from downfalls. In this way, the retinue of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha, will increase. Noble lady, you are acting in a way that makes you unapproachable.

original: kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong zhig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong zhig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: They should be told, ‘This assembly of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha has increased through mutual discussion, mutual instruction, and mutual exhortation to abandon downfalls. Noble lady, you should give up this kind of activity that makes you unfit to be discussed.’

original: dge slong ma de la dge slong ma rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na /
analyzed: dge slong ma de la dge slong ma rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na /
translated: If the bhikṣuṇī is addressed in this way by the bhikṣuṇīs,

original: gal te gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
translated: and if she then gives up that basis, all is well.

original: gal te mi gtong na gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya /
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya /
translated: But if she does not give it up, she should be pressed up to three times to give it up.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: If she gives it up, all is well.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
translated: But if she does not give it up, she commits an offense and should be pressed up to three times to give it up.

original: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
translated: If, when pressed, she gives up that basis, all is well.

analyzed: gal te mi gtong na chos 'di yang lan gsum gyi bar gyis ltung bar 'gyur la 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: But if she does not give it up, then this offense of hers is to be acknowledged three times, and it is a sanghâvaśeṣa offense entailing a period of probation.

analyzed: 'phags ma dag bdag gis dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos nyi shu po dag bton zin to //

analyzed: de dag las bcu gnyis ni ltung ba dang po nyid kyis so //
translated: Of these, twelve are to be acknowledged three times,

original: brgyad ni lan gsum gyi bar gyis so //
analyzed: brgyad ni lan gsum gyi bar gyis so //
translated: and eight are to be acknowledged once.

original: dge slong mas de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la /
analyzed: dge slong mas de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la /
translated: If a nun commits any of these offenses,

analyzed: ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab par byed pa de srid du de mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba bya'o //
translated: then for as long as she conceals it knowingly, for that long she must undergo probation unwillingly.

analyzed: dge slong mas mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba byas nas de'i 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du gnyi ga'i dge 'dun mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o //
translated: After a nun has undergone probation unwillingly, then for a fortnight she must practice the observance-day ceremony and the training of the probationer.

original: dge slong mas mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te /
analyzed: dge slong mas mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te /
translated: If a nun is suspended for not making amends for a grave offense,

original: chos dang mthun par byas la gnyi ga'i @14a *//🔽sems mgu bar byas nas gang na gnyi ga'i dge 'dun bzhi bcu'i tshogs yod pa der dge slong ma dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang mthun par byas la gnyi ga'i @14a *// sems mgu bar byas nas gang na gnyi ga'i dge 'dun bzhi bcu'i tshogs yod pa der dge slong ma dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: she should be sent away in accordance with the Dharma.🔽If she has pleased both Sanghas, she should be sent away to a place where there is a Saṅgha of at least forty monks and nuns.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyis dge slong ma de 'byin par byed na /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyis dge slong ma de 'byin par byed na /
translated: If she is sent away by a Saṅgha of monks and nuns that is incomplete by one,

original: dge slong ma de yang ma phyin la /
analyzed: dge slong ma de yang ma phyin la /
translated: she is not sent away.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
translated: And that Saṅgha is to be reproached.

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no //🔽de la bdag gis 'phags ma dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no // de la bdag gis 'phags ma dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: This is the proper procedure.🔽“‘I ask the noble ones—is the community purified?🔽I ask the second time—is the community purified?

original: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: I ask the third time—is the community purified?🔽Since the noble ones are silent, that is how it will be.’

original: 'di la 'phags ma dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di la 'phags ma dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: “‘The noble ones have been purified in this matter.

original: sdom la / 'chang ba 'bral ba 'jog pa dang / 'khru ba dang ni len pa dang // slong dang stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas //
analyzed: sdom la / 'chang ba 'bral ba 'jog pa dang / 'khru ba dang ni len pa dang // slong dang stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas //
translated: begging, upper robe, lower robe,

original: rin thang so sor skur ba'o //
analyzed: rin thang so sor skur ba'o //
translated: and the value of wool.

original: 'phags ma dag spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu rtsa gsum po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags ma dag spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu rtsa gsum po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Venerable ones, these thirty-three rules on offenses entailing confession come up in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month.

original: dge slong ma chos gos zin pas sra brkyang byung nas zhag bcu'i bar du gos lhag pa rung ba ma byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma chos gos zin pas sra brkyang byung nas zhag bcu'i bar du gos lhag pa rung ba ma byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “A nun whose robes are finished may keep an extra robe for ten days at the most without making it suitable.

original: de las lhag par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //

translated: Also, if a bhikṣuṇī engages in various kinds of buying and selling, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang lhung bzed lhan pa lnga med pa spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir lhung bzed gsar pa gzhan tshol zhing grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma des lhung bzed @17a *//
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang lhung bzed lhan pa lnga med pa spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir lhung bzed gsar pa gzhan tshol zhing grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma des lhung bzed @17a *//
translated: Also, if a bhikṣuṇī, while possessing a alms bowl with less than five mends that is suitable for use, seeks another new alms bowl because she wants a better one, and she obtains it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽That alms bowl

original: de dge slong ma'i 'khor la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dge slong ma'i 'khor la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: She should give it to the community of nuns.

original: dge slong ma 'khor de'i lhung bzed mthar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong ma de la /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'khor de'i lhung bzed mthar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong ma de la /
translated: The nun who has the oldest almsbowl in that community of nuns should say to that nun,

original: dge slong ma khyod kyis lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya //
analyzed: dge slong ma khyod kyis lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya //
translated: ‘Nun, you should not consecrate this almsbowl.

original: gtang bar mi bya /
analyzed: gtang bar mi bya /
translated: You should not give it away.

original: gzhan la sbyin par mi bya bar chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du khad kyis dal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par mi bya bar chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du khad kyis dal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o //
translated: You should not give it to anyone else. You should use it gradually, slowly, until it breaks.’

original: zhes sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes sbyin par bya ste /
translated: She should give it to her like this.

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no //
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no //
translated: This is the proper conduct in this case.

original: yang dge slong ma gang rang gis blangs pa'i dog pa tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na gos grub na spang ba'i lhung byed do //🔽dge slong ma'i phyir khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang rang gis blangs pa'i dog pa tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na gos grub na spang ba'i lhung byed do // dge slong ma'i phyir khyim bdag gam /
translated: ‘If a nun herself asks a non-relative weaver to weave wool, and she gets the weaver to weave it into cloth, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”🔽A householder🔽or a householder’s wife who is not a relative of the nun

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug pa las /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug pa las /
translated: asks a weaver who is not a relative of the nun to weave wool into cloth for the nun.

original: de na gal te dge slong ma de la sngar ma bstabs par rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung nas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa'i gan du song ste /🔽'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong ma de la sngar ma bstabs par rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung nas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa'i gan du song ste / 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa shes par gyis shig /
translated: “If, before being offered, that nun has some kind of thought and then goes to a non-relative weaver,🔽and says,

original: gos 'di kho mo'i phyir 'thag gi /
analyzed: gos 'di kho mo'i phyir 'thag gi /
translated: ‘Venerable weaver, know that I am having this cloth woven.

original: tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa gos 'di zhes che ba dang / khrun ring pa dang / thar gyis zhag pa dang / thag ran bzang po legs par gyis shig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa gos 'di zhes che ba dang / khrun ring pa dang / thar gyis zhag pa dang / thag ran bzang po legs par gyis shig /
translated: Venerable weaver, make this cloth long and wide, make it well-woven and well-finished.

original: tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa kho mos gla rngan 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa kho mos gla rngan 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable weaver, I will give you a small gift,

original: bza' ba'am / bca' ba'am /
analyzed: bza' ba'am / bca' ba'am /
translated: such as food, or a drink,

original: bza' rgyu cung zad cig sbyin no zhes smras nas /
analyzed: bza' rgyu cung zad cig sbyin no zhes smras nas /
translated: or something to eat.’

original: de la gal te dge slong ma des gos sgrub pa'i phyir gla rngan 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gal te dge slong ma des gos sgrub pa'i phyir gla rngan 'di lta ste /
translated: “If, for the sake of obtaining that cloth, that nun gives that weaver a small gift,

original: bca' ba'am / bza' ba'am /
analyzed: bca' ba'am / bza' ba'am /
translated: such as food, or a drink,

original: bza' rgyu cung zad cig byin zhing gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: bza' rgyu cung zad cig byin zhing gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: or something to eat, and then obtains the cloth, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: yang dge slong ma gang dge @17b slong ma la gos byin nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /🔽yi ma rangs nas 'phrog gam /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dge @17b slong ma la gos byin nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te / yi ma rangs nas 'phrog gam /
translated: “Also, a nun who gives a robe to a monk and then, out of anger,

original: 'phrog tu 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'phrog tu 'jug cing /
translated: takes it back or has it taken back,🔽saying,

original: de la 'di skad ces dge slong ma khyod la gos mi sbyin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces dge slong ma khyod la gos mi sbyin gyi /
translated: ‘Venerable, I will not give you the robe.

original: phyir byin cig ces zer na /
analyzed: phyir byin cig ces zer na /
translated: Give it back to me,’

original: dge slong ma de la lhag ma yod na de la phyir sbyin par bya zhing btang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong ma de la lhag ma yod na de la phyir sbyin par bya zhing btang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: then, if there is a remainder of the robe, she should return it to her. If she does not return it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag la sgyur du 'jug na spang pa'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag la sgyur du 'jug na spang pa'i ltung byed do //
translated: “If a nun knowingly diverts to an individual a gift intended for the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma na ba rnams la phan pa so sor bstan par bya ba'i sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma na ba rnams la phan pa so sor bstan par bya ba'i sman gang dag bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
translated: “The Buddha, the Blessed One, has taught the following about medicines that are allowable for sick nuns:

original: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / bu ram dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba de dag las dge slong ma na bas 'dod na /
analyzed: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / bu ram dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba de dag las dge slong ma na bas 'dod na /
translated: If a sick nun wishes for clarified butter, oil, molasses, honey, or sugar-candy,

original: rang gis zhag bdun gyi bar byin gyis brlabs te gsog 'jog gis yongs su spyad pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis zhag bdun gyi bar byin gyis brlabs te gsog 'jog gis yongs su spyad pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o //
translated: she may, if necessary, keep it for seven days, having received it with the ritual of “medicine that may be kept for seven days.”

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: If she uses it beyond that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong mas lhung bzed lhag pa zhag gcig gi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas lhung bzed lhag pa zhag gcig gi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “A nun should keep an extra alms bowl for one day.

original: de las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: If she keeps it longer than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang chos gos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba nyi ma dang po la'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang chos gos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba nyi ma dang po la'am /
translated: “If a nun has a set of three robes that is ritually valid,🔽she must not go beyond one day without performing the robe-making ceremony.

original: zla pa'i phyed phyed cing byin gyis mi rlob na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: zla pa'i phyed phyed cing byin gyis mi rlob na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: If she does, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽The chapter on relinquishment🔽The chapter on relinquishment is finished.

original: sdom la 'byin dang mi 'byin slong ba dang // gos dang gos rgyu mal cha rgyu //
analyzed: sdom la 'byin dang mi 'byin slong ba dang // gos dang gos rgyu mal cha rgyu //
translated: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment and confession

original: dbyar khang rgyu dang skye bo dang // dge 'dun bcings dkrol lci yang ngo //
analyzed: dbyar khang rgyu dang skye bo dang // dge 'dun bcings dkrol lci yang ngo //
translated: The Saṅgha, the binding and unbinding, the heavy and light.

original: yang dge slong ma gang dus ma yin par sra brkyang 'byin na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma gang dus su sra brkyang mi 'byin @18a *//
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dus ma yin par sra brkyang 'byin na spang ba'i ltung byed do // yang dge slong ma gang dus su sra brkyang mi 'byin @18a *//
translated: Again, if a bhikṣuṇī takes out the rains-residence robe at the wrong time, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma gang bdag gi phyir mngon mtshan can slong na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma gang gzhan gyi ched du rnyed pa'i gos zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: na spang ba'i ltung byed do // yang dge slong ma gang bdag gi phyir mngon mtshan can slong na spang ba'i ltung byed do // yang dge slong ma gang gzhan gyi ched du rnyed pa'i gos zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: Again, if a bhikṣuṇī does not take out the rains-residence robe at the right time, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽Again, if a bhikṣuṇī makes a robe for herself that has distinguishing marks, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽Again, if a bhikṣuṇī stores for her own use any robe-cloth or food that she has received for the benefit of others, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang gos kyi ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gos kyi ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: Again, if a bhikṣuṇī stores for her own use any robe-cloth or food that she has received for the benefit of others, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang mal cha'i ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang mal cha'i ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Also, if a nun, for the sake of bedding, stores any kind of gain that is suitable for food, for the sake of eating it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang dbyar khang gi ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong ma gang dge slong ma'i skye bo mang po'i phyir sbyor du bcug pa'i rnyed pa gang zag la yongs su sbyar na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dbyar khang gi ched du rnyed pa gang yang rung ba zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do // yang dge slong ma gang dge slong ma'i skye bo mang po'i phyir sbyor du bcug pa'i rnyed pa gang zag la yongs su sbyar na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Also, if a nun, for the sake of a rainy season retreat house, stores any kind of gain that is suitable for food, for the sake of eating it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽“Also, if a nun uses for an individual what has been gained for a group of nuns, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi phyir sbyor du bcug pa'i rnyed pa gang zag dag la yongs su sgyur na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi phyir sbyor du bcug pa'i rnyed pa gang zag dag la yongs su sgyur na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Also, if a nun uses for an individual what has been gained for the Sangha of nuns, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang chags par gyur pas thum po bcings shing bcings shing 'grol du bcug na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang chags par gyur pas thum po bcings shing bcings shing 'grol du bcug na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Also, if a nun, being desirous, has a man tie up a bundle and then untie it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gos lcid dang rin thang lci ba 'chang na sdang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Monks, if a monk keeps a heavy and valuable robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: yang dge slong ma gang lcid yang ba rin thang lci ba 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang lcid yang ba rin thang lci ba 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: “Monks, if a monk keeps a light and valuable robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: sdom la / srin bal 'ba' zhig cha gnyis dang // drug dang mthe gang lam dang ni //
translated: The summary: Cotton, only, two parts, Six, and fingerbreadth, road,

original: 'khru dang 'chang dang brtad dang dgon //
analyzed: 'khru dang 'chang dang brtad dang dgon //
translated: Washing, keeping, bidding, and wilderness.

original: ras chen ma gtogs lhag ma yin //
analyzed: ras chen ma gtogs lhag ma yin //
translated: Except for the large piece, the rest.

original: @18b 'phags ma dag /
analyzed: @18b 'phags ma dag /

analyzed: bdag gis spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu rtsa gsum po dag bton zin to //
translated: I have recited the thirty-three rules on relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: de la bdag gis 'phags ma dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam /
translated: Now I ask the venerables, ‘Are you pure in this?’🔽And a second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

analyzed: zhes dri'o // ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //

analyzed: 'di la 'phags ma dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to ////
translated: Since the venerables are silent, they are considered pure in this matter.

analyzed: dge slong ma'i so sor thar pa'i mdo //

analyzed: bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: This is the second and final part.

original: spyi sdom la /
analyzed: spyi sdom la /
translated: The general summary:🔽Lying, seeds, dwelling places,🔽living beings, animals,

analyzed: rdzun dang sa bon 'dug gnas dang // srog chags bde dang dud 'gro dang // rku ba dang ni zas bcas pa //
translated: stealing, and food—

analyzed: de dag mthun mong yin par 'dod //
translated: these are considered common.🔽The summary:🔽Lying, faults, bhikṣus, slander,🔽discouragement, teaching,

analyzed: sdom la; rdzun skyon dge slong phra ma dang // skyo sngogs byed dang ston pa dang // 'don dang gnas ngan len dang chos //
translated: reciting, depravity, Dharma,

analyzed: bshes ngor byed dang khyad du gsod // 'phags ma dag ltung byed kyi chos brgya brgyad cu po 'di dag ni /
translated: favoring friends, and contempt.

analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Venerable ones, these one hundred and eighty downfalls are to be recited every half month from the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: shes bzhin du rdzun du smra na ltung byed do //
analyzed: shes bzhin du rdzun du smra na ltung byed do //
translated: If one knowingly tells a lie, there is a downfall.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung byed do //
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung byed do //
translated: If one speaks of the faults of humans, there is a downfall.

original: dge slong ma la phra ma byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong ma la phra ma byed na ltung byed do //
translated: If one engages in slander against a bhikṣuṇī, there is a downfall.

analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang dge 'dun mthun pas chos bzhin du rtsod pa sbyangs pa shes bzhin du yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed na ltung byed do //
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who, knowing that a dispute has been settled according to the Dharma by the united Saṅgha, stirs up the issue again commits a pāyantika.

original: yang dge slong ma gang skyes pa'i yul la tshig lnga'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang skyes pa'i yul la tshig lnga'am /
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who teaches the Dharma to men with more than five or six words

analyzed: drug las lhag par chos ston na rig pa'i bud med ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: commits a pāyantika, except in the case of a woman who understands.

original: yang dge slong ma gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang tshig gis chos 'don na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang tshig gis chos 'don na ltung byed do //
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who recites the Dharma with a man commits a pāyantika,

original: yang dge slong ma gang @19a *//🔽gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang @19a *// gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: except in the case of a woman who understands.🔽“Any bhikṣuṇī who, without permission from the Saṅgha, reveals the faults of a person who has not yet received full ordination commits a pāyantika.

original: yang dge slong ma gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden par smra na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi'i chos bla ma bden par smra na ltung byed do //
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who truthfully says that a person who has not yet received full ordination has a serious offense commits a pāyantika.

original: yang dge slong ma gang sngar legs par rung bar byas nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces 'phags ma dag 'di ltar bshes ngor phyas te dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa bdag gi gang zag la bsngos so zhes zer na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang sngar legs par rung bar byas nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces 'phags ma dag 'di ltar bshes ngor phyas te dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa bdag gi gang zag la bsngos so zhes zer na ltung byed do //
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who, after having previously agreed, were then to say, ‘Noble ones, having been partial and biased, I have dedicated the gains of the Saṅgha to an individual,’ then that bhikṣuṇī too has a downfall.”

original: yang dge slong ma gang zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don na 'di skad ces /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don na 'di skad ces /
translated: “Any bhikṣuṇī who, when reciting the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month, were to say,

original: 'phags ma dag gang dag gis dge slong ma rnams 'gyod pa dang / yid la gcags pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs rab tu phra ba 'di dag gis zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa bton pa dag gis ci zhig bya /
